intro: Triumfetta pseudorhomboidea, commonly known as the African blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a branching stem covered in fine hairs. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adaptable to various environmental conditions.
